methods.name: createDraft(recipient, subject, body, options)
methods.description:
Creates a draft email message with optional arguments. The email can contain plain text or an
HTML body. The size of the email (including headers, but excluding attachments) isquota limited.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: the maximum number of threads to retrieve

methods.description: Retrieves a range of Inbox threads irrespective of labels.

methods.description: Gets the number of unread threads in the inbox.

Reloads the messages and associated state from Gmail (useful in case the labels, read state,
etc., have changed).

etc., have changed).

parameters.name: threads
parameters.description: the threads to be refreshed

methods.name: refreshThreads(threads)

Reloads the threads and associated state from Gmail (useful in case the labels, read state,
etc., have changed).

methods.name: copyBlob()
methods.description: Returns a copy of this blob.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The MIME type to convert to. For most blobs,'application/pdf'is
    the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of'image/bmp','image/gif','image/jpeg', or'image/png'are also
    valid. For a Google Docs document,'text/markdown'is also valid.

methods.name: getAs(contentType)
methods.description:
Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type. This
method adds the appropriate extension to the filenameâ€”for example, "myfile.pdf". However, it
assumes that the part of the filename that follows the last period (if any) is an existing
extension that should be replaced. Consequently, "ShoppingList.12.25.2014" becomes
"ShoppingList.12.25.pdf".

methods.name: getBytes()
methods.description: Gets the data stored in this blob.

methods.name: getContentType()
methods.description: Gets the content type of the bytes in this blob.

methods.name: getDataAsString()
methods.description: Gets the data of this blob as a String with UTF-8 encoding.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The charset to use in encoding the data in this blob as a string.

methods.name: getDataAsString(charset)
methods.description: Gets the data of this blob as a string with the specified encoding.

methods.name: getHash()
methods.description:
Gets the SHA1 content hash for this attachment. This method does not count against the Gmail
read quota.

methods.name: getName()
methods.description: Gets the name of this blob.

methods.name: getSize()
methods.description: Gets the size of this attachment. This method is faster than callinggetBytes().lengthand does not count against the Gmail read quota.

methods.name: isGoogleType()
methods.description: Returns whether this blob is a Google Workspace file (Sheets, Docs, etc.).

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The new data.

methods.name: setBytes(data)
methods.description: Sets the data stored in this blob.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: The new contentType.

methods.name: setContentType(contentType)
methods.description: Sets the content type of the bytes in this blob.

methods.name: setContentTypeFromExtension()
methods.description: Sets the content type of the bytes in this blob based on the file extension. The contentType isnullif it cannot be guessed from its extension.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string data.

methods.name: setDataFromString(string)
methods.description: Sets the data of this blob from a string with UTF-8 encoding.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string data.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The charset to use in interpreting the string as bytes.

methods.name: setDataFromString(string, charset)
methods.description: Sets the data of this blob from a string with the specified encoding.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name.

methods.name: setName(name)
methods.description: Sets the name of this blob.

methods.name: getAllBlobs()
methods.description: Deprecated.This function is deprecated and should not be used in new scripts.

Replaces the contents of this draft message using optional arguments. The email can contain

parameters.name: thread
parameters.description: The thread to be labeled.

methods.name: addToThread(thread)
methods.description: Adds this label to the given thread and forces the thread to refresh (GmailThread.refresh()).

parameters.name: threads
parameters.description: An array of threads to be labeled.

methods.description:
Adds this label to the given threads and forces the threads to refresh. You can add labels for
up to 100 threads per batch.

methods.name: deleteLabel()
methods.description: Deletes this label.

methods.name: getId()
methods.description: Gets the id of this label.

methods.name: getName()
methods.description: Gets the name of this label.

methods.name: getThreads()
methods.description: Gets the threads that are marked with this label.

parameters.description: The index of the starting thread.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum number of threads to return.

methods.name: getThreads(start, max)
methods.description: Gets a range of threads marked with this label.

methods.name: getUnreadCount()
methods.description: Gets the number of unread threads tagged with this label.

parameters.name: thread
parameters.description: The thread be unlabeled.

methods.name: removeFromThread(thread)
methods.description: Removes this label from the given thread and forces the thread to refresh.

parameters.name: threads
parameters.description: An array of threads to be unlabeled.

methods.name: removeFromThreads(threads)
methods.description:
Removes this label from the given threads and forces the threads to refresh. You can remove
labels for up to 100 threads per batch.

parameters.name: body

methods.description:
Creates a draft message replying to the sender of this message using the reply-to address. The
size of the email (including headers) isquota limited.

parameters.description: The body of the email.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A JavaScript object that specifies advanced parameters, as listed below.

methods.description:
Creates a draft message replying to the sender of this message using the reply-to address, with
optional arguments.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of the email.

methods.name: createDraftReplyAll(body)
methods.description:
Creates a draft message replying to the sender using the reply-to address and all recipients of
this message. The size of the email (including headers) isquota limited.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A JavaScript object that specifies advanced parameters, as listed below.

methods.name: createDraftReplyAll(body, options)
methods.description:
Creates a draft message replying to the sender of this message using the reply-to address and
all recipients, with optional arguments.

parameters.name: recipient

methods.name: getCc()

methods.name: getDate()
methods.description: Gets the date and time of this message.

methods.name: getFrom()

methods.description: Gets the value of an RFC 2822 header given the header name.

methods.name: getId()
methods.description: Gets the ID of this message.

methods.name: getPlainBody()
methods.description: Gets the content of the body of this message without HTML formatting. This is more complex thangetBody()and takes longer.

methods.name: getRawContent()
methods.description: Gets the raw content of this message. This is equivalent to "Show Original" in the Gmail UI.

methods.name: getReplyTo()
methods.description: Gets the reply-to address of this message (usually the sender).

methods.name: getSubject()
methods.description: Gets the subject of this message.

methods.name: getThread()
methods.description: Gets the thread that contains this message.

methods.name: getTo()
methods.description: Gets the comma-separated recipients of this message.

methods.description: Gets whether this message is a draft.

methods.description: Gets whether this message is a chat.

methods.name: isInInbox()
methods.description: Gets whether this message is in the inbox.

methods.name: isInPriorityInbox()
methods.description: Returnstrueif this message is in the priority inbox; returnsfalseotherwise.

methods.name: isInTrash()
methods.description: Gets whether this message is in the trash.

methods.name: isStarred()

etc., have changed).

methods.name: getFirstMessageSubject()
methods.description: Gets the subject of the first message in the thread.

methods.name: getId()
methods.description:
Gets the ID of this thread. The ID of a thread varies based on the messages it contains; for a
consistent ID for a particular message in the thread, callgetMessages()[0].getId()instead.

methods.name: getLabels()
methods.description: Returns the user-created labels on this thread.

methods.name: getLastMessageDate()
methods.description: Gets the date of this thread's most recent message.

methods.name: getMessageCount()
methods.description: Returns the number of messages in the thread.

methods.name: getMessages()
methods.description: Gets the messages in this thread.

methods.name: getPermalink()
methods.description: Gets a permalink for this thread.

methods.name: hasStarredMessages()
methods.description: Returns whether the thread has any starred messages.

methods.name: isImportant()
methods.description: Returns whether the thread is marked as important.

methods.name: isInChats()
methods.description: Returns whether the thread is labeled a chat.

methods.name: isInInbox()
methods.description: Returns whether the thread is in the inbox.

methods.name: isInPriorityInbox()
methods.description: Returns true if this thread is in the priority inbox; returns false otherwise.

methods.name: isInSpam()
methods.description: Returns whether the thread is marked as spam.

methods.name: isInTrash()
methods.description: Returns whether the thread is in the trash.

methods.name: isUnread()
methods.description: Returns whether the thread has any unread messages.

methods.name: markImportant()
methods.description: Marks this thread as important.

methods.name: markRead()
methods.description: Marks this thread as read.

methods.name: markUnimportant()
methods.description: Marks this thread as unimportant.

methods.name: markUnread()
methods.description: Marks this thread as unread.

methods.name: moveToArchive()
methods.description: Moves this thread to the archive.

methods.name: moveToInbox()
methods.description: Moves this thread to the inbox.

methods.name: moveToSpam()
methods.description: Moves this thread to spam.

methods.name: moveToTrash()
methods.description: Moves this thread to the trash.

methods.name: refresh()
methods.description:
Reloads this thread, and associated state from Gmail (useful in case the labels, read state,
etc., have changed).

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: the label to remove from this thread

methods.name: removeLabel(label)
methods.description: Removes this label from the thread.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the body of the email

methods.name: reply(body)
methods.description: Reply to the sender of the last message on this thread using the replyTo address.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the body of the email

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: a JavaScript object that specifies advanced parameters, as listed below

methods.name: reply(body, options)
methods.description:
Reply to the sender of the last message on this thread using the replyTo address, with optional
arguments. The email can contain both plain text, and also an HTML body. Note that the total
size of the email (including all headers, but excluding attachments) may not exceed 20KB.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the body of the email

methods.name: replyAll(body)
methods.description:
Reply to the sender (using the replyTo address), and all recipients of the last message on this
thread.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the body of the email

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: a JavaScript object that specifies advanced parameters, as listed below

methods.name: replyAll(body, options)
methods.description:
Reply to the sender (using thereplyToaddress), and all recipients of the last message
on this thread, with optional arguments. The email can contain both plain text, and also an
HTML body. Note that the total size of the email (including all headers, but excluding
attachments) may not exceed 20KB.
